str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To meet, go to meet. From hupo and a derivative of anti; to go opposite under, i.e. To encounter, fall in with.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, monument, memorial. From mnaomai; a memorial, i.e. Sepulchral monument.
